Title: Technical Game Designer III - AI Foundations (Contract)
RoleDescription:
Engineers at Riot master their craft by building, launching, and operating games that delight players all over the world. As a Technical Game Designer, you will dive into projects that focus on leveraging team cohesiveness and cross-team goals to deliver amazing player experiences. You'll lead development efforts, steer design processes, and exemplify the teams culture.
As a Technical Game Designer on the AI Foundations team, you will contribute to both the engineering and design efforts to deliver robust and reliable ML/AI systems to help accelerate titles throughout the Game AI development lifecycle. You will use your design expertise in game mechanics, games systems architecture, and understanding of AI/ML data systems, to help us deliver unmatched player impact. Professional experience using an object-oriented programming language.
Experience planning technical and design efforts for projects.
Experience owning features in a rapid development environment.
Experience balancing product goals with design decisions.
Track record of shipping experiences for titles using Unreal Engine, working with Blueprints, and/or other technical workflows.
Experience coaching those around them across all roles, and mentoring mid and senior level team members.
Excellent written and verbal communication.
Experience designing systems in large, ambiguous spaces.

Experience leading game features.

In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. As the most played video game in the world, over 100 million play every month. Drive continuous process improvement and documentation to support visibility, velocity, and craft health.
Ensure smooth collaboration with external vendors and clear, timely feedback on outsourced work.

10+ years of experience in video games, with strong knowledge of cosmetic development pipelines.
4+ years of direct management experience in an art or creative production role.
Proven success in leading teams through live-service development or operating at scale.
Deep understanding of game art fundamentals (concept, 3D, VFX, animation, UI).
Familiarity with production pipelines and tools for mobile game development.
Experience giving feedback across disciplines and guiding cross-functional teams.

Experience shipping a mobile game or supporting a live-service product with regular cosmetic updates.
Background in skin or cosmetics pipelines for a major IP.
Strong collaboration history with external partners or regional co-dev teams (especially in Asia).

Title: Researcher III - Central Product Insights
RoleDescription:
The Insights discipline helps empower Rioters' decision-making to be more data-informed. We're an interdisciplinary group of scientists, consultants, and strategists from all sorts of backgrounds who join together to represent and advocate for gamers around the world. We believe that illuminating the globally diverse experiences, behaviors, and needs of gamers is critical to Riot living up to our player-focused mission. We're a group united by our love of games, science, and helping others succeed.
As a Senior Researcher on the Central Product Insights Team, youll be responsible for helping Riot deepen our understanding of our live games performance, our foundational portfolio and product strategy, growth opportunities for our games, and the state of the global games landscape. You'll conduct a wide range of studies and analyses often in partnership with researchers on game teams - including qualitative interviews and global market surveys - to inform our holistic understanding of the global gamer audience, the state of our current live games, and the strategy for games across our portfolio. Youll be part of an interdisciplinary team working closely with a diverse group of specialists to turn the findings of your research into recommendations and action. Your research background coupled with your deep understanding of the games industry and Riots games will ensure that youre an effective advocate for players and can provide strategic guidance about their wants, needs, and behaviors.
Responsibilities:

Work as part of a central team to improve Riots understanding of our games, our portfolio and product strategies, and key competitors 
Construct, organize, and execute studies and surveys across a variety of methods designed to answer business and product strategy questions, in complex ambiguous problem spaces
Manage and improve the state of central research tools, resources, and data sources aimed to provide scaled services to the games insights organization
Partner with analysts, researchers, and designers to generate insights and frameworks thatll inform the strategic direction of various games
Be an effective advocate for players and provide strategic guidance about their wants, needs, and behaviors
Share your results with other Rioters in clear presentations, documented processes and guides, as well as Tableau dashboards
Mentor other researchers, helping them learn from your own experiences

Required Qualifications: 

Bachelor's degree in Psychology, Anthropology, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related discipline plus 4 years of relevant research experience (an advanced degree can account for 1 to 2 years of experience depending on Masters or PhD)
Broad experience in quantitative and qualitative research methods including conducting interviews, focus groups, and online community studies, as well as performing survey research with deep expertise in at least one of these areas
Experience conducting research to answer product or portfolio strategy questions
Experience synthesizing & socializing research results and distilling results into impactful recommendations for product leadership
Trusted to operate independently regardless of structure, owns complex problems/projects/workstreams

Desired Qualifications:

2+ years doing research specifically in the games industry
Familiarity with basic statistical methods for data analysis (regressions, correlations, factor analyses)
Experience working directly with senior executives and/or senior stakeholders
Experience working with game teams, including PMs, designers, engineers, artists
Experience managing vendors
Experience coordinating and collaborating with analysts on joint projects to better understand products or users
Experience utilizing and synthesizing syndicated / external datasets on competitors
Experience with desktop research on competitors and industry trends
Personal experience (as a developer or player) across a variety of game genres, including the ones that Riot has games in

Analyze HR metrics, trends and qualitative data to drive informed decision-making and provide insights/recommendations to senior leadership.

Title: Video Editor (Contract)
RoleDescription:
Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. As the most played PC game in the world, over 100 million play every month. Players form the foundation of our community and its for them that we continue to evolve and improve the League of Legends experience. 
Were looking for humble but ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take play seriously; youre passionate about games. We embrace those who see things differently, arent afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints.
That's where you come in.
As a Video Editor (Contract), youll be a member of the Singapore-based team, working alongside local developers and creatives to shape compelling video content for Riot. Youll contribute to ideation, editing, and localization of videos, supporting Riots mission to deliver resonant, impactful storytelling through video. This role goes beyond technical executionyoull help craft the creative direction, make strong editorial decisions based on story beats, and ensure every video maintains high production value and emotional resonance.
Please note that Riot Games does not offer relocation packages for this position. You need to be able to work legally in Singapore, without Riot Games sponsorship, to be considered.
Responsibilities:
Pre-Production Collaboration

Participate in pre-production planningdevelop beat sheets, shot lists, and narrative arcs.
Contribute to the creative strategy and planning of video projects.
Collaborate with team members on storyboards, and story planning tools.

Project Coordination & Communication

Maintain clear channels of communication with local developers, aligning on scripts and shoot schedules.
Collaborate with IT and Comms teams to coordinate event screenings, ensuring technical setup and delivery run smoothly.
Track progress against pre-arranged timelines, providing regular updates to stakeholders.

Filming & Equipment Setup

Set up a small-scale filming environment with mirrorless cameras, 2- or 3-point lighting, and audio equipment.
Operate a teleprompter for scripted segments, ensuring on-camera talent remains prepared.
Utilize a gimbal for stabilized shots and dynamic camera movement.

Video Editing & Post-Production

Edit raw footage into engaging, polished videos suitable for internal audiences (e.g., staff updates, product demos).
Incorporate basic storytelling principles, making editing choices motivated by story beats.
Manage file exports across various video formats, understanding differences in codecs and compression.
Handle difficult footage with skill and create emotionally resonant stories.
Apply basic color correction and create motion graphics when needed.
Make editing decisions rooted in pacing, tone, motivation, and strong narrative flow.
Integrate music and sound elements to elevate emotion and story beats.

Media Management & Archiving

Organize and archive all media files in a consistent, logical manner to facilitate easy retrievals.
Work with team leads to ensure naming conventions, file structures, and version control are maintained properly.

Required Qualifications:
Technical Proficiency

Intermediate experience with mirrorless cameras, basic lighting setups, and audio recording gear.
Familiarity with at least one non-linear editing (NLE) application (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut, DaVinci Resolve).
Understanding of audio track layout standards and basic audio mixing techniques is a plus.
Comfortable exporting footage to common video codecs and maintaining high-quality standards.

Storytelling & Editing Technique

Grasps fundamental story structures (e.g., three-act structure) to keep viewers engaged.
Makes purposeful editing decisions that support the narrative, ensuring smooth pacing and clarity.

Collaboration & Communication

Excellent team player, able to communicate effectively and diplomatically with multiple stakeholders (developers, IT, comms).
Open to constructive feedback, adjusting editing choices as needed to reflect broader project goals.
Demonstrates professionalism and reliability to meet agreed-upon deadlines.

Organization & Problem-Solving

Able to multi-task across shooting schedules, editing timelines, and event coordination.
Strong media management skills, including consistent naming conventions and archival processes.
Comfortable troubleshooting minor tech issues with hardware or software, escalating when necessary.
